sentence.Network_en: I was lightheaded, glad my ordeal was over.
sentence.Network_cn: 我高兴得轻飘飘地,总算熬到头了.

sentence.Network_en: Ten to one he was lightheaded at the time.
sentence.Network_cn: 十有八九,他当时已神志恍惚.

sentence.Network_en: She had a sense of relief which left her curiously lightheaded.
sentence.Network_cn: 她感到松了一口气,这莫明其妙地使她变得轻浮起来了.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 第七天 ... adj. 带头的；最重要的 lightheaded adj. 头昏眼花的；三心二意的；无知的；轻浮的 liter n. 公升（容量单位）.
I thought perhaps he was a little lightheaded ,, 我以为他也许有点头晕.

list.abs: People might also feel lightheaded and sick to their stomach ., 他们也可能会感到头昏眼花和胃里不舒服.
Gerard was no longer lightheaded , but very irritable ., 杰勒德不再头晕 , 但非常烦燥.
lightful 明亮的lighthead 轻率的人lightheaded 头昏眼花的
I thought perhaps he was a little lightheaded ,, 我以为他也许有点头晕.

entry.tran: （因生病、醉酒等而）头晕目眩的
entry.def: If you feel light-headed, you feel rather unsteady and strange, for example because you are ill or because you have drunk too much alcohol.

example.ex: If you skip breakfast, your blood sugar level will drop and you will probably feel light-headed.
example.tran: 如果不吃早餐，血糖含量就会降低，你很可能会觉得晕眩。

means.word_mean: 1. weak and likely to lose consciousness;

auth_sentence.content: But when he turned back to the overfilled apartment he was lightheaded.
auth_sentence.res_content: But when he turned back to the overfilled apartment he was lightheaded.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: But when he turned back to the overfilled apartment he was lightheaded.

auth_sentence.content: We flew, pounding the pavements barefoot, I feeling strangely lightheaded, my normal limp gone.
auth_sentence.res_content: We flew, pounding the pavements barefoot, I feeling strangely lightheaded, my normal limp gone.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: We flew, pounding the pavements barefoot, I feeling strangely lightheaded, my normal limp gone.
